result.execSummary:
The defendant Krista J Butterbach was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Fail/Comply-Officer/Person into Custody, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.415(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Krista J Butterbach in court with Attorney Joseph Smith.  Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing. Bound over.  Information filed.  Reading is waived.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count #1.  Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Count #1.  Counts #2 is dismissed and read-in.  Attorney Smith requests a sentencing date.   Bail remains as fixed.
